vaapidecodebin.author: Sreerenj Balachandran <sreerenj.balachandran@intel.com>, Victor Jaquez <victorx.jaquez@intel.com>
vaapidecodebin.description: A VA-API based bin with a decoder and a postprocessor

sink.caps:
video/mpeg:
    mpegversion: 2
   systemstream: false
video/mpeg:
    mpegversion: 4
video/x-divx:
video/x-xvid:
video/x-h263:
video/x-h264:
video/x-h265:
video/x-wmv:
video/x-vp8:
video/x-vp9:

src.caps:
video/x-raw(memory:VASurface):
         format: { ENCODED, NV12, YV12, I420, YUY2, UYVY, Y444, GRAY8, P010_10LE, VUYA, Y210, Y410, ARGB, xRGB, RGBA, RGBx, ABGR, xBGR, BGRA, BGRx, RGB16, RGB, BGR10A2_LE }
          width: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
         height: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
      framerate: [ 0/1, 2147483647/1 ]
 interlace-mode: progressive

video/x-raw(meta:GstVideoGLTextureUploadMeta):
         format: { RGBA, BGRA }
          width: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
         height: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
      framerate: [ 0/1, 2147483647/1 ]
 interlace-mode: progressive
video/x-raw:
         format: { I420, YV12, YUY2, UYVY, AYUV, VUYA, RGBx, BGRx, xRGB, xBGR, RGBA, BGRA, ARGB, ABGR, RGB, BGR, Y41B, Y42B, YVYU, Y444, v210, v216, Y210, Y410, NV12, NV21, GRAY8, GRAY16_BE, GRAY16_LE, v308, RGB16, BGR16, RGB15, BGR15, UYVP, A420, RGB8P, YUV9, YVU9, IYU1, ARGB64, AYUV64, r210, I420_10BE, I420_10LE, I422_10BE, I422_10LE, Y444_10BE, Y444_10LE, GBR, GBR_10BE, GBR_10LE, NV16, NV24, NV12_64Z32, A420_10BE, A420_10LE, A422_10BE, A422_10LE, A444_10BE, A444_10LE, NV61, P010_10BE, P010_10LE, IYU2, VYUY, GBRA, GBRA_10BE, GBRA_10LE, BGR10A2_LE, RGB10A2_LE, GBR_12BE, GBR_12LE, GBRA_12BE, GBRA_12LE, P012_BE, P012_LE, I420_12BE, I420_12LE, Y212_BE, Y212_LE, I422_12BE, I422_12LE, Y412_BE, Y412_LE, Y444_12BE, Y444_12LE, GRAY10_LE32, NV12_10LE32, NV16_10LE32, NV12_10LE40, Y444_16BE, Y444_16LE, P016_BE, P016_LE }
          width: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
         height: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
      framerate: [ 0/1, 2147483647/1 ]
 interlace-mode: progressive

async-handling.blurb: The bin will handle Asynchronous state changes

disable-vpp.blurb: Disable Video Post Processing (No support for run time disabling)

max-size-buffers.blurb: Max. number of buffers in the queue (0=disable)

max-size-bytes.blurb: Max. amount of data in the queue (bytes, 0=disable)

max-size-time.blurb: Max. amount of data in the queue (in ns, 0=disable)

base-only.blurb: Drop any NAL unit not defined in Annex.A

low-latency.blurb: When enabled, frames will be pushed as soon as they are available. It might violate the H.264 spec.

vaapih264enc.author: Wind Yuan <feng.yuan@intel.com>
vaapih264enc.description: A VA-API based H264 video encoder

sink.caps:
video/x-raw:
         format: { NV12, YV12, I420 }
          width: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
         height: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
      framerate: [ 0/1, 2147483647/1 ]
 interlace-mode: progressive

video/x-raw(memory:VASurface):
         format: { NV12, YV12, I420 }
          width: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
         height: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
      framerate: [ 0/1, 2147483647/1 ]
 interlace-mode: progressive

bitrate.blurb: The desired bitrate expressed in kbps (0: auto-calculate)

compliance-mode.blurb: Tune Encode quality/performance by relaxing specification compliance restrictions

cpb-length.blurb: Length of the CPB buffer in milliseconds

dct8x8.blurb: Enable adaptive use of 8x8 transforms in I-frames

default-roi-delta-qp.blurb: The default delta-qp to apply to each Region of Interest(lower value means higher-quality, higher value means lower-quality)

keyframe-period.blurb: Maximal distance between two keyframes (0: auto-calculate)

max-bframes.blurb: Number of B-frames between I and P

num-views.blurb: Number of Views for MVC encoding

qp-ib.blurb: Difference of QP between I and B frame (available only on CQP)

qp-ip.blurb: Difference of QP between I and P frame (available only on CQP)

quality-factor.blurb: quality factor for ICQ/QVBR bitrate control mode(low value means higher-quality, higher value means lower-quality)

quality-level.blurb: Encoding Quality Level (lower value means higher-quality/slow-encode,  higher value means lower-quality/fast-encode)

target-percentage.blurb: The desired target percentage of bitrate for variable rate controls.

temporal-levels.blurb: Number of temporal levels in the encoded stream

trellis.blurb: The Trellis Quantization Method of Encoder

view-ids.blurb: Set of View Ids used for MVC encoding

bitrate.blurb: The desired bitrate expressed in kbps (0: auto-calculate)

cpb-length.blurb: Length of the CPB buffer in milliseconds

default-roi-delta-qp.blurb: The default delta-qp to apply to each Region of Interest(lower value means higher-quality, higher value means lower-quality)

keyframe-period.blurb: Maximal distance between two keyframes (0: auto-calculate)

low-delay-b.blurb: Transforms P frames into predictive B frames. Enable it when P frames are not supported.

max-bframes.blurb: Number of B-frames between I and P

qp-ib.blurb: Difference of QP between I and B frame (available only on CQP)

qp-ip.blurb: Difference of QP between I and P frame (available only on CQP)

quality-factor.blurb: quality factor for ICQ/QBVR bitrate control mode (lower value means higher quality, higher value means lower quality)

quality-level.blurb: Encoding Quality Level (lower value means higher-quality/slow-encode,  higher value means lower-quality/fast-encode)

target-percentage.blurb: The desired target percentage of bitrate for variable rate controls.

trellis.blurb: The Trellis Quantization Method of Encoder

skin-tone-enhancement-level.blurb: Apply the skin tone enhancement algorithm with specified level

blocksize.blurb: Size in bytes to pull per buffer (0 = default)

force-aspect-ratio.blurb: When enabled, scaling will respect original aspect ratio

last-sample.blurb: The last sample received in the sink

max-bitrate.blurb: The maximum bits per second to render (0 = disabled)

max-lateness.blurb: Maximum number of nanoseconds that a buffer can be late before it is dropped (-1 unlimited)

processing-deadline.blurb: Maximum processing time for a buffer in nanoseconds

render-delay.blurb: Additional render delay of the sink in nanoseconds

show-preroll-frame.blurb: Whether to render video frames during preroll

signal-handoffs.blurb: Send a signal after rendering the buffer

throttle-time.blurb: The time to keep between rendered buffers (0 = disabled)

view-id.blurb: ID of the view component of interest to display

values.desc: Strict compliance to the H264 Specification
values.name: strict

values.desc: Restrict the allocation size of coded-buffer
values.name: restrict-buf-alloc

values.desc: Default encode, prev/next frame as ref
values.name: default
